title: flow_expected_results data dictionary
about: Human-readable definitions for columns in flow_expected_results.csv. This file is descriptive only and is NOT used for strict schema validation.

fields.name: seg_id
fields.description: Unique internal segment identifier used across the course network.

fields.name: segment_label
fields.description: Human-readable segment name, e.g., 'Friel to 10K Turn' or 'Start to Queen/Regent'.

fields.name: event_a
fields.description: Event or race type corresponding to side A (e.g., Full, Half) in a comparison with event_b.

fields.name: event_b
fields.description: Event or race type corresponding to side B (e.g., 10K) in a comparison with event_a.

fields.name: total_a
fields.description: Total number of participants from event A (matches participant count in runners.csv for that event).

fields.name: total_b
fields.description: Total number of participants from event B.

fields.name: flow_type
fields.description: Indicates flow relationship type between event A and event B.

enum_definitions.co-flow: Both events move in the same direction along the segment.
enum_definitions.counter-flow: Events move in opposite directions along the same segment.
enum_definitions.shared: Events overlap in space and/or time with mixed directions.
enum_definitions.divergent: Events split into separate routes after this segment.
enum_definitions.convergent: Events merge onto the same route, increasing density.

fields.name: from_km_a
fields.description: Start kilometer mark of this segment for event_a, expressed as the actual distance from the official start line of event A (not normalized or scaled).

fields.name: to_km_a
fields.description: End kilometer mark of this segment for event_a, expressed as the actual course distance for event A. Represents the true on-course position, not a normalized segment fraction.

fields.name: from_km_b
fields.description: Start kilometer mark of this segment for event_b, measured from the official start line of event B. This is the real race distance point, not a normalized or relative value.

fields.name: to_km_b
fields.description: End kilometer mark of this segment for event_b, measured as the actual cumulative distance of event B’s course. Represents the physical location along the race route.

fields.name: width_m
fields.description: Average width of the course at this segment (in meters).

fields.name: overtaking_a
fields.description: Total number of overtaking events initiated by participants of event A in this segment. This is an event count, not a unique-runner count — the same runner may appear in multiple overtaking events if they overtake more than one participant within the segment.

fields.name: overtaking_b
fields.description: Total number of overtaking events initiated by participants of event B. This represents total events rather than unique runners; a single participant can contribute multiple times if they perform multiple overtakes.

fields.name: sample_a
fields.description: Preview list of up to three runner IDs from event A who initiated overtakes on this segment. The '(... (10 total))' marker indicates that at least 10 distinct overtakers existed, but only the first three are displayed. This value is capped for readability; actual distinct overtakers may exceed the displayed total.

fields.name: sample_b
fields.description: Preview list of up to three runner IDs from event B who initiated overtakes on this segment. The '(... (10 total))' marker indicates that at least 10 distinct overtakers existed, but only the first three are displayed. This is a truncated display sample, not a comprehensive list.

fields.name: pct_a
fields.description: Proportion of total overtaking events by event A relative to all overtaking events in this segment (values are proportions on a 0–1 scale).

fields.name: pct_b
fields.description: Proportion of total overtaking events by event B relative to all overtaking events in this segment (values are proportions on a 0–1 scale).

fields.name: copresence_a
fields.description: Percentage of time event A participants shared spatial proximity with other participants (same direction) (values are proportions on a 0–1 scale).

fields.name: copresence_b
fields.description: Percentage of time event B participants shared spatial proximity with other participants (same direction) (values are proportions on a 0–1 scale).

fields.name: unique_encounters
fields.description: Number of unique participant-to-participant encounters across both events on this segment.

fields.name: participants_involved
fields.description: Count of distinct participants involved in any overtaking or copresence interactions on this segment.

fields.name: overtaking_load_a
fields.description: Relative load (overtakings per meter per minute) for event A, normalized to segment length/time.

fields.name: overtaking_load_b
fields.description: Relative load for event B.

fields.name: max_overtaking_load_a
fields.description: Maximum concurrent overtaking events for event A at peak density.

fields.name: max_overtaking_load_b
fields.description: Maximum concurrent overtaking events for event B.

fields.name: spatial_zone_exists
fields.description: True if the segment has an overlapping spatial zone between A and B.

fields.name: temporal_overlap_exists
fields.description: True if the overlapping spatial zone also overlaps in time (runners present simultaneously).

fields.name: true_pass_exists
fields.description: True if a confirmed overtaking event occurred (both spatial and temporal criteria met).

fields.name: has_convergence_policy
fields.description: True if the segment is governed by a convergence policy (e.g., merge or split section).

fields.name: has_convergence
fields.description: True if actual participant flow convergence occurred in this segment.

fields.name: convergence_zone_start
fields.description: Normalized position (0.0–1.0) within the segment where convergence begins, expressed as a fraction of total segment length. For example, 0.25 means 25% into the segment.

fields.name: convergence_zone_end
fields.description: Normalized position (0.0–1.0) within the segment where convergence ends, expressed as a fraction of total segment length. For example, 0.60 means convergence ends 60% of the way through the segment.

fields.name: no_pass_reason_code
fields.description: Reason overtaking was not detected or was suppressed for this segment. Common values include: 'SPATIAL_ONLY_NO_TEMPORAL', 'TEMPORAL_ONLY_NO_SPATIAL', 'NO_COPRESENCE', 'NO_SPEED_DIFFERENTIAL', 'MANUAL_SUPPRESSION', 'INSUFFICIENT_DATA'.

fields.name: conflict_length_m
fields.description: Distance (in meters) over which overlapping flow or conflict was detected (float, meters).

fields.name: data_source
fields.description: The files used to create the flow report (as found in the /data folder).

fields.name: start_times
fields.description: Start times associated with the events contributing to the flow segment.

fields.name: min_overlap_duration
fields.description: Minimum time (seconds) two events overlap spatially within this segment.
